item.title: Three die from electrocution in Gopalganj
item.description: Three people, including a grandmother and her grandson, died from electrocution in Kashiani upazila of Gopalganj district last night. The incident occurred around 8:30 pm at Tetulia village under Rajpat union of the upazila. The deceased were identified as Rahela Begum, 50, wife of Mosarraf Shikd

item.title: Demand to reinstate Biman’s Manchester–Sylhet route debated in British parliament
item.description: A demand to reconsider Biman Bangladesh Airlines’ decision to suspend regular flights on the Manchester–Sylhet route has been raised in the British parliament, as concerns grow over higher travel costs and disrupted links between the UK and Bangladesh. Speaking in the House of Common

item.title: Purbachal plot graft: Verdict against Hasina, Tulip, Bobby on Feb 2
item.description: A Dhaka court will deliver its verdict in a case over corruption in the allocation of plots in Purbachal against Radwan Mujib Siddiq Bobby, the nephew of ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina, on Feb 2. A total of 18 suspects, including Hasina and her niece and British MP Tulip Siddiq, are accused i

item.title: Iran restores limited internet
item.description: Some citizens in Iran have been provided with access to the Internet after several days of nationwide blackout, the semi-official Mehr news agency reported on Saturday, without giving more details. Also on Saturday, the country restored short message service (SMS), reports Xinhua. Iran imposed se

item.title: Rapid growth gives impetus to financial inclusion: BB report
item.description: Bangladesh has made significant progress in expanding financial inclusion, driven largely by rapid growth in digital financial services, agent banking and microfinance, according to a Bangladesh Bank report. In its review of the country's financial inclusion landscape up to December 2024, the Bang

item.title: 45 more contestants regain candidacies on eighth day of hearings
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) on Saturday approved 45 more appeals on the eighth day of hearings on challenges against returning officers' decisions on the scrutiny of nomination papers for the 13th National Parliamentary Election. A total of 112 review appeal applications were taken up for hearing

item.title: Chhatra Dal protests outside Nirbachan Bhaban over EC’s role ahead of Feb polls
item.description: Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD), the student wing of the BNP, on Sunday continued its demonstration in front of Nirbachan Bhaban, protesting the Election Commission’s “biased and controversial” role ahead of the upcoming national election slated for February 12 next. JCD activists

item.title: Why Bangladesh needs a mentoring culture to forge its future leaders
item.description: Every year, hundreds of thousands of graduates leave Bangladesh's universities with their degrees in hand. item.title: Patients suffer as intern doctors continue work stoppage at Osmani Hospital
item.description: Patients at Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital are facing severe difficulties as intern doctors continue a work stoppage following an attack on a female intern doctor. Intern doctors at the hospital have been on strike for 24 consecutive hours after failing to reach an agreement with the a

item.title: Dhaka University Cultural Society welcomes new 'Oitri' batch
item.description: The Dhaka University Cultural Society held its annual reception programme 'Oitri Baran' on Thursday at the TSC Auditorium, welcoming its newest batch of members with an evening of performances that stretched from 2 pm well into the night. item.title: BUET Entrepreneurs Network launches BUETEN Summit 2026
item.description: The BUET Entrepreneurs Network (BUETEN) has announced its flagship event, the BUETEN Summit 2026, to be held on January 23 and 24 at the Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET) campus in Dhaka. item.title: Two killed in Tangail road accident
item.description: Two people were killed and two others injured in a road accident at Basail upazila of Tangail district last evening.
